intro: Seseli leiocarpum, commonly known as the white-rayed sesame or white-rayed seseli, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of eastern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots, parsley, and dill, and is characterized by its compound umbels of small white flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Seseli leiocarpum is often found in dry, rocky soils and is considered a rare and somewhat elusive species in its native habitat.
